articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Ahmad Shadeed)
articles.description: In this article, we‚Äôll be taking a closer look at two gradients: `conic-gradient` and `radial-gradient`. You‚Äôll see how each one of them works in detail, what the differences and similarities are between them, how and where to use them, and some use cases for each.

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Scott Himmer)
articles.description: Product roadmaps are often treated as a series of checkboxes. But they are more than that. In this article, Scott Himmer explains how internal partnerships, research, design systems, and regular touch bases can help make sure that your product roadmap is a successful one.
articles.title: Changing A Tire On A Moving Car (Or How To Improve Product Roadmaps)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Luis Ouriach)
articles.description: In this article (the first part in a series of two), Luis Ouriach shares advice that he wishes he has when starting out in his career. These tips come from his experience as a user interface and product designer for close to ten years, and if you‚Äôre starting just now, then read on!
articles.title: Ten Tips For Aspiring Designer Beginners (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Aleksandra Nagornaia)
articles.description: Figma has advanced enough where it now supports some powerful concepts that can help with the flexibility and maintainability of a design system. In this article, Sasha explains why she finds the Systems Designer position so rewarding ‚Äî and it‚Äôs not only because of how fast certain tools have developed to help her master challenges she faces in her work projects.
articles.title: Composition-Based Design System In Figma

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What better way could there be to start the new year than with some fresh inspiration? Our collection of wallpapers for January 2022 is bound to put a smile on your face ‚Äî and maybe spark new ideas, too.
articles.title: New Year, Fresh Desktop (January 2022 Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paul Boag)
articles.description: Scoping, estimating, and running digital projects can often feel like an exercise in futility. In this article, Paul Boag explains why you need to start breaking your projects down into manageable phases and why that‚Äôs the best way to achieve significant benefits.
articles.title: How To Price Projects And Manage Scope Screep

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Paulina Hetman)
articles.description: Have you already built and published a Gatsby theme? In this article, Paulina Hetman explains how Gatsby themes work and what problems they can solve by comparing Gatsby themes with their WordPress counterparts.
articles.title: Building Gatsby Themes For WordPress-Powered Websites

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Alyssa Holland)
articles.description: Range inputs have notoriously been a pain to style. Each browser renders the input differently requiring you to use vendor prefixes in order to create a cohesive look and feel. In this article, we‚Äôll take a look at the quirkiness of the HTML range input and demonstrate how to style the input to look consistent across all major browsers.
articles.title: Creating A Custom Range Input That Looks Consistent Across All Browsers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: A meaningful user experience is what can set your site apart from others. But what makes an experience truly meaningful? And how to achieve that? The tools, tips, and resources in this post not only help you to come up with a UX strategy that works for you and your team but also to circumvent potential UX pitfalls.
articles.title: Useful UX Guidelines, Tools And Resources

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Barry Pollard)
articles.description: How to improve Core Web Vitals, a Smashing Magazine case study on how we detected and fixed the bottlenecks, and how we ended up with green scores, all the way.
articles.title: Improving Core Web Vitals, A Smashing Magazine Case Study

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nick Babich & Gleb Kuznetsov)
articles.description: Modern HMIs are transforming the way we interact with our vehicles. A car becomes a gadget that we use in a similar way as we use our phones. In this article, let‚Äôs look at some ways to help us satisfy users‚Äô needs with proper design.
articles.title: Designing Human-Machine Interfaces For Vehicles Of The Future

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Nwani Victory)

articles.title: Billing Management For Your Next SaaS Idea Using Stripe And Azure Functions

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Steven Hoober)

articles.title: Touch Design For Mobile Interfaces: Defining Mobile Devices (Excerpt)

articles.title: Modifying Headers In HTTP(s) Requests In UI Automation Testing

articles.description: One of the most important composite data types in Python is the dictionary. It's a collection you use to store data in {key:value} pairs. articles.title: Python Dictionary ‚Äì How to Perform CRUD Operations on dicts in Python

articles.description: It may sound surprising, but you already have all it takes to produce high-level logic: right behind your eyes.  In the first term of college, I was introduced to a subject called Logic. In the "I think, therefore I am" fashion, you might think this would be an easy subject.
articles.title: Propositional Logic for Beginners ‚Äì You Already Know More Than You Think

articles.description: What is Margin Collapse?Margin collapse occurs when vertically adjacent margins of block-level elements collide to share a general margin space. articles.description: Search algorithms are a fundamental computer science concept that you should understand as a developer.
